docs.title: Character Progression
docs.text: Hunters advance through experience, becoming more skilled and powerful over time. This page covers Experience Points (XP), costs for improvements, and how to advance your character in Herald.

docs.title: What is XP?
docs.text:
Experience Points represent your character's growth through gameplay. You earn XP from:

  • Completing sessions (typically 1-3 XP per session)
  • Accomplishing major goals
  • Good roleplaying (Storyteller discretion)
  • Overcoming challenges
  • Character development moments

docs.title: XP Tracking
docs.text:
Herald tracks three XP values:

  • Total Earned - All XP you've ever received
  • Spent - XP used for improvements
  • Available - Total - Spent (what you can spend now)

docs.title: Viewing Your XP
docs.text:
/xp action:view

Displays: - Total XP earned - XP spent - Available XP - Recent XP history - Spending guide with costs

docs.title: Adding XP (Storyteller)
docs.text:
/xp action:add amount:3 reason:"Completed vampire nest mission"

Adds XP to your total. Reason is optional but helpful for tracking.

docs.title: Spending XP
docs.text:
When you improve something (attributes, skills, etc.), XP is automatically deducted.

Example: 

# You have 12 available XP
# Want to raise Firearms from 2 to 3

/skill_set skill:Firearms dots:3

# Cost: New rating × 2 = 3 × 2 = 6 XP
# Herald automatically spends 6 XP
# You now have 6 available XP

docs.title: Setting XP Directly (Storyteller)
docs.text:
/xp action:set amount:50

Sets your total earned XP to a specific value.

docs.title: Spending XP Manually
docs.text:
/xp action:spend amount:5 reason:"Purchased new Edge perk"

Manually record XP spent (useful for things not tracked automatically).

docs.title: Attributes
docs.text:
Cost: New Rating × 4 XP

Attributes range from 1-5 and can never be 0.

Improvement New Rating XP Cost 1 → 2 2 8 XP 2 → 3 3 12 XP 3 → 4 4 16 XP 4 → 5 5 20 XP

Example: 

# Raising Dexterity from 3 to 4
/attributes attribute:Dexterity dots:4
# Cost: 4 × 4 = 16 XP

Note: Raising Stamina, Resolve, or Composure also updates Health/Willpower automatically.

docs.title: Skills
docs.text:
Cost: New Rating × 2 XP

Skills range from 0-5.

Improvement New Rating XP Cost 0 → 1 1 2 XP 1 → 2 2 4 XP 2 → 3 3 6 XP 3 → 4 4 8 XP 4 → 5 5 10 XP

Example: 

# Raising Investigation from 2 to 3
/skill_set skill:Investigation dots:3
# Cost: 3 × 2 = 6 XP

Tip: Skills are cheaper than attributes. Invest in skills first for immediate power.

docs.title: Specialties
docs.text:
Cost: 3 XP each

Specialties provide bonus dice when applicable.

Requirements: - Skill must have at least 1 dot - Maximum specialties = skill dots (minimum 1)

Example: 

# Adding "Pistols" specialty to Firearms 3
/specialty action:add skill:Firearms specialty:Pistols
# Cost: 3 XP

Herald automatically tracks the cost and prevents adding more specialties than allowed.

docs.title: Edges
docs.text:
Cost: Variable (Storyteller discretion)

Edges represent major supernatural advantages. Costs typically range from:

  • Assets (Arsenal, Fleet, etc.): 10-15 XP
  • Aptitudes (Improvised Gear, etc.): 10-15 XP
  • Endowments (Sense the Unnatural, etc.): 15-20 XP

Acquiring Edges: 1. Discuss with Storyteller (must fit narrative) 2. Pay XP cost (tracked manually via /xp spend) 3. Add Edge to character (/edge action:add)

Example: 

# Adding Sense the Unnatural (15 XP)
/xp action:spend amount:15 reason:"Purchased Sense the Unnatural Edge"
/edge action:add
(Select Sense the Unnatural)

docs.title: Edge Perks
docs.text:
Cost: Variable (3-10 XP, Storyteller discretion)

Perks enhance existing Edges with specialized abilities.

Requirements: - Must have the Edge that the Perk belongs to - Perk must make narrative sense

Example: 

# Adding "Exotics" perk to Arsenal Edge (5 XP)
/xp action:spend amount:5 reason:"Purchased Arsenal: Exotics perk"
/perks action:add edge_name:Arsenal perk_name:Exotics

docs.title: Early Game (0-30 XP earned)
docs.text:
Focus: Core competencies

Priorities: 1. Primary skills to 3 dots - Your main abilities 2. Add specialties - Cheap power boost 3. Round out skill gaps - Get 1 dot in important skills 4. Consider one Edge - Major capability addition

Example Build: 

Start: Firearms 2, Investigation 2, Stealth 1
Spend 10 XP:
- Firearms 2→3 (6 XP)
- Add specialty "Pistols" to Firearms (3 XP)
- Stealth 1→2 (4 XP total, spend 1 more)

docs.title: Mid Game (30-60 XP earned)
docs.text:
Focus: Excellence and versatility

Priorities: 1. Primary skills to 4 dots - Become expert 2. Raise key attribute - Expensive but valuable 3. Add second Edge - Expand capabilities 4. More specialties - Expertise in your focus areas

Example Build: 

Raise Dexterity 3→4 (16 XP)
Firearms 3→4 (8 XP)
Add Sense the Unnatural Edge (15 XP)
Total: 39 XP

docs.title: Late Game (60+ XP earned)
docs.text:
Focus: Mastery and legendary abilities

Priorities: 1. Skills to 5 dots - Master level 2. Attributes to 4-5 - Peak human capability 3. Multiple Edges with Perks - Supernatural powerhouse 4. Complete specialty coverage - Bonuses everywhere

Example Build: 

Firearms 4→5 (10 XP)
Intelligence 3→4 (16 XP)
Add Library Edge (15 XP)
Add 3 Library Perks (15 XP)
Total: 56 XP

docs.title: Typical XP Awards
docs.text:
Per Session: - Standard session: 1-2 XP - Exceptional session: 3 XP - Major milestone: 4-5 XP

Special Awards: - Completing character Ambition: 3-5 XP - Major story arc resolution: 2-3 XP - Exceptional roleplaying: 1-2 XP - Character development moment: 1 XP

docs.title: Campaign Progression
docs.text:
Short Campaign (10 sessions): - Total XP: 15-30 XP - Characters advance from competent to skilled

Medium Campaign (25 sessions): - Total XP: 35-60 XP - Characters become experts in their fields

Long Campaign (50+ sessions): - Total XP: 70-150+ XP - Characters achieve mastery and legend status

docs.title: What Can You Improve?
docs.text:
Anytime (with XP): - Skills (practice makes perfect) - Specialties (focused training)

Requires Narrative Justification: - Attributes (major life changes) - Edges (supernatural events) - Perks (using Edge creatively)

docs.title: Narrative Justification
docs.text:
Herald mechanics are tied to story. When improving:

Skills: - "I've been practicing at the range" (Firearms) - "I've been researching vampires every night" (Occult) - "I've been following suspects" (Stealth)

Attributes: - "Months of physical training" (Strength, Dexterity, Stamina) - "Therapy and meditation" (Composure, Resolve) - "Studying and reading constantly" (Intelligence)

Edges: - "After that experience with the artifact, I can sense them now" (Sense the Unnatural) - "My contacts came through with weapons" (Arsenal) - "I've been experimenting with improvising gear" (Improvised Gear)

Work with your Storyteller to ensure improvements make sense.

docs.title: Efficiency
docs.text:
Most Bang for Buck: 1. Specialties (3 XP) - Cheap, immediate bonus 2. Skills 0→1 (2 XP) - Remove untrained penalty 3. Skills to 3 - Sweet spot of capability 4. Edges - Major new abilities

Expensive But Worth It: 1. Key attributes to 4 - Foundation for everything 2. Primary skills to 5 - Mastery in your specialty 3. Multiple Edges - Versatility and power

docs.title: Balanced vs. Specialized
docs.text:
Balanced Character: - Spread XP across multiple skills - Cover more situations - More versatile in changing circumstances

Example: 

30 XP spread:
Firearms 2→3 (6 XP)
Investigation 2→3 (6 XP)
Athletics 1→2 (4 XP)
Stealth 1→2 (4 XP)
Add 3 specialties (9 XP)

Specialized Character: - Focus XP on one area - Become the best at one thing - Rely on team for other needs

Example: 

30 XP focused:
Firearms 2→4 (4+8=14 XP)
Dexterity 3→4 (16 XP)

docs.title: Long-Term Planning
docs.text:
100 XP Character Example:

Starting Build:
Dexterity 3, Wits 3
Firearms 2, Investigation 2, Stealth 2

50 XP Spent:
- Dexterity 3→4 (16 XP)
- Firearms 2→4 (4+8=12 XP)
- Investigation 2→4 (4+8=12 XP)
- Add 3 specialties (9 XP)

Result at 50 XP:
Dexterity 4, Firearms 4, Investigation 4
With 3 specialties providing bonuses

Next 50 XP:
- Wits 3→4 (16 XP)
- Firearms 4→5 (10 XP)
- Add Sense the Unnatural (15 XP)
- Add 3 Perks to Sense (9 XP)

Result at 100 XP:
Master investigator and marksman with supernatural senses

docs.title: Frequently Asked Questions
docs.text: Common questions about Herald and how to use it.

docs.title: What is Herald?
docs.text: Herald is a Discord bot specifically designed for Hunter: The Reckoning 5th Edition. It handles character management, dice rolling with H5E mechanics, Edge and Desperation tracking, and character progression.

docs.title: Is Herald free?
docs.text: Yes! Herald is completely free to use. There are no premium tiers or paid features.

docs.title: How do I add Herald to my server?
docs.text: See the Adding Herald guide for step-by-step instructions.

docs.title: What permissions does Herald need?
docs.text: Herald needs: - Send Messages (required) - Embed Links (required) - Use External Emoji (recommended for dice displays)

docs.title: Can I use Herald for other World of Darkness games?
docs.text: Herald is built specifically for Hunter: The Reckoning 5E. While some features might work for other games, it's optimized for H5E mechanics (Edge, Desperation, etc.).

docs.title: How many characters can I have?
docs.text: There's no hard limit! You can create as many characters as you need across different servers.

docs.title: Are my characters private?
docs.text: Character data is stored per-server. Your character "Raven" on Server A is separate from "Raven" on Server B.

docs.title: Can I transfer characters between servers?
docs.text: Not currently. Each server maintains its own character database.

docs.title: I deleted my character by accident! Can I get it back?
docs.text: Unfortunately, character deletion is permanent and cannot be undone. Always use the confirmation button carefully!

docs.title: Can I rename my character?
docs.text: Yes! Use /rename old_name:Raven new_name:Corvus to rename a character.

docs.title: Why are my dice showing as text instead of emojis?
docs.text:
Herald uses custom emojis for dice. If you see text, either: 1. Herald doesn't have the Use External Emoji permission 2. Your Discord settings have website previews disabled

Herald automatically falls back to text mode if emojis aren't available.

docs.title: What do the different dice symbols mean?
docs.text:
• 🎲 with red numbers = Desperation dice
  • 🎲 with gray numbers = Regular dice
  • 10 = Critical (2 successes)
  • 6-9 = Success (1 success)
  • 1-5 = Failure

docs.title: What's a "Messy Critical"?
docs.text: A messy critical happens when Desperation dice roll 10s. You get the successes, but something goes wrong. Your Storyteller will describe the complication.

docs.title: How does difficulty work?
docs.text: Difficulty is the number of successes you need. It's not the target number for dice - Herald uses the H5E system where 6+ is always a success.

docs.title: Can I roll without a character?
docs.text: Yes! Use /roll attribute:3 skill:2 to roll manually without character stats.

docs.title: What is Edge?
docs.text: Edge represents a Hunter's supernatural insight and power. It adds dice to your rolls and has special properties in H5E.

docs.title: When should I use Desperation dice?
docs.text: Desperation dice are typically used when: - You're in grave danger - You're desperate to succeed - Your Storyteller calls for it - You have a Desperation rating

docs.title: Do Desperation dice replace regular dice?
docs.text: No! Desperation dice are added to your pool. They're shown separately because they can cause messy criticals.

docs.title: How do I track Desperation changes?
docs.text: Use /desperation character:Raven desperation:3 to update your Desperation rating.

docs.title: How do skill templates work?
docs.text: Skill templates apply H5E-standard skill distributions: - Balanced - Well-rounded (7/5/3/1) - Specialist - Focused expert (9/5/1/0) - Jack-of-all-trades - Broad competence (5/5/5/0)

docs.title: Can I mix templates and manual skills?
docs.text: Yes! Apply a template for a quick start, then use /skill_set to customize specific skills.

docs.title: How does XP spending work?
docs.text: Use /spend_xp to improve attributes or skills. Herald automatically: - Deducts the XP cost - Updates the trait - Recalculates derived stats - Logs the transaction

docs.title: What are specialties?
docs.text:
Specialties are areas of expertise within skills. When your specialty applies, you get +1 die to rolls.

Example: Firearms (Pistols) gives +1 die when using pistols.

docs.title: Why aren't slash commands showing up?
docs.text: If commands aren't appearing: 1. Wait a few minutes - Discord can be slow to sync 2. Check Herald has Use Application Commands permission 3. Ensure the @everyone role can use slash commands 4. Try restarting Discord 5. Type the command anyway - it might work!

docs.title: Can I use text commands instead of slash commands?
docs.text: No, Herald only uses Discord's slash command system. This provides better autocomplete and clearer parameter names.

docs.title: Do I need to type full character names?
docs.text: No! Herald supports autocomplete. Start typing and it will suggest your characters.

docs.title: Herald isn't responding to commands
docs.text: Check: 1. Herald is online (green status) 2. Herald has permissions in the channel 3. You're using slash commands (start with /) 4. Commands are synced (may take a few minutes after adding Herald)

docs.title: I'm getting "Character not found" errors
docs.text:
Make sure: 1. Character name is spelled correctly (case doesn't matter) 2. Character was created on this server 3. You own the character (you created it)

Use /characters to list all your characters on the server.

docs.title: Dice rolls look wrong
docs.text:
Herald follows H5E rules exactly: - 6-9 = 1 success - 10 = 2 successes (critical) - 1-5 = no success

If you think there's a bug, report it in our Support Server.

docs.title: My character sheet is cut off
docs.text: Discord has limits on embed size. If your character has extensive equipment or notes, consider shortening them or splitting across multiple fields.

docs.title: Can I restrict who can use Herald?
docs.text: Yes! Use Discord's slash command permissions in Server Settings → Integrations → Herald to control who can use commands.

docs.title: Can I limit Herald to specific channels?
docs.text: Yes! You can: 1. Remove Herald's permissions from unwanted channels 2. Use Discord's command channel overrides 3. Set up a dedicated #herald-rolls channel

docs.title: Does Herald log anything?
docs.text:
Herald logs: - XP transactions (viewable with /xp_log) - Character creation/deletion (local to each server)

Herald does NOT log: - Roll results - Private character data - User messages

docs.title: Where can I report bugs?
docs.text:
• Join our Support Discord
  • Post in the #bug-reports channel
